instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't run off battery
threads.message:
Hi there.

I successfully repaired this board a few days ago after it failed to power on. There was excessive buildup of corrosion around the SMC as well as a few other components. I had to repair traces and replace multiple damaged capacitors and resistors using a donor board. What finally got it up and running was a reflow of the SMC. I reinstalled the board and ran full diagnostics and it passed with flying colors. This lasted about a week.

The Mac was brought back in today having issues with extremely slow performance. I diagnosed a batterry issue after it ran well while plugged into a charger. Unfortunatlety now it wont run off battery at all. As soon as you pull the plug it immediatley shuts off. Battery is recognized and charging while plugged in. Swapping out with other good battery produced same result. I pulled the board and its not staying powered on with battery. Charger connected works fine.

I tested voltages and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is a steady 8.16v on battery, 3.41v for PP3V42. I am not sure what to look for next. None of the 5V or 3V voltages are present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't run off battery
threads.message:
Did you only reflow SMC?
Must always be reballed, when detect corrosion on its area.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Won't run off battery
threads.message: Reballed SMC. Problem is now fixed. Thank you.
